sorcer.service

Interface Exertion

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Evaluation<Object>, Identifiable, Invocation<Object>, Mappable, Serializable, Service
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    CompoundExertion
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AltExertion, AntTask, Block, EvaluationTask, Job, LoopExertion, NetBlock, NetJob, NetTask, ObjectBlock, ObjectJob, ObjectTask, OptExertion, ServiceExertion, SignedServiceTask, Task

    public interface Exertion
extends Service, Mappable, Evaluation<Object>, Invocation<Object>, Serializable, Identifiable
    An exertion is a federated service command (statement) communicated by a requestor - Service.service(sorcer.service.Exertion, net.jini.core.transaction.Transaction), to a service provider Service. It is a form of service-oriented message with an enclosed service Context and a collection of service Signatures. The service context specifies service data to be processed by the service providers matching exertion's signatures. An exertion's signature can carry own implementation when its type is associated with a provided codebase.
    Exertions are request interseptors in the form of command objects (in the Command programming pattern) that keep a service requestor completely separate from the actions that service providers carry out. Exertions are also completely separate from each other and do not know what other exertions do. However, they can pass parameters via contexts by mapping Context.map(java.lang.String, java.lang.String, sorcer.service.Context) expected input context values in terms of expected output values calculated by other exertion. The operation exert(net.jini.core.transaction.Transaction, sorcer.service.Arg...) of this interface provides for execution of desired actions enclosed in exertions, thus keeping the knowledge of what to do inside of the exertions, instead of having another parts of SO program to make these decisions. When an exertion is invoked then the exertion redirects control to a dynamically bound Service matching the exertion's signature of type Operator.Type PROCESS.
    The Exertion interface also provides for the Composite design pattern and defines a common elementary behavior for all exertions of Task type and control flow exertions (for branching and looping). A composite exertion called Job contains a collection of elementary, flow control, and other composite exertions with the same elementary behavior performed collectively by all its members. Thus Tasks and control flow exertions are analogous to programming statements and Jobs analogous to procedures in conventional procedural programming.
    Control flow exertions allow for branching and looping operations by Services executing exertions. A job combined from tasks and other jobs along with relevant control flow exertions is a service-oriented procedure that can federate its execution with multiple service providers bound dynamically in runtime as determined by Signatures of job component exertions.
    Author:
    Mike Sobolewski
    See Also:
    sorcer.service.AsyncExertion

      • getFidelity

      • getFlowType

        Strategy.Flow getFlowType()
        Returns a flow type for this exertion execution. A flow type indicates if this exertion can be executed sequentially, in parallel, or concurrently with other component exertions within this exertion. The concurrent execution requires all mapped inputs in the exertion context to be assigned before this exertion can be executed.
        Returns:
        a flow type
        See Also:
        Flow}.

      • getAccessType

        Strategy.Access getAccessType()
        Returns a provider access type for this exertion execution. An access type indicates whether the receiving provider specified in the exertion's process signature is accessed directly (Acess.PUSH) or indirectly (Acess.PULL) via a shared exertion space.
        Returns:
        an access type
        See Also:
        Access}.

      • exert

        <T extends Exertion> T exert(Transaction txn,
                             Arg... entries)
                      throws TransactionException,
                             ExertionException,
                             RemoteException
        Sends this exertion to the assigned service provider if set. If a service provider is not set then in runtime it bounds to any available provider that matches this exersion's signature of the PROCESS type.
        Parameters:
        txn - The transaction (if any) under which to exert.
        Returns:
        a resulting exertion
        Throws:
        TransactionException - if a transaction error occurs
        ExertionException - if processing this exertion causes an error
        RemoteException
        See Also:
        #setService

      • isJob

        boolean isJob()
        Returns true if this exertion requires execution by a Jobber, otherwise false if this exertion requires its execution by a Tasker. Note that control follow exertion can be processed by either a Tasker or a Jobber.
        Returns:
        true if this exertion requires execution by a Jobber.
